required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunoadsorption Versus Plasma Exchange for Treatment of Guillain-Barré Syndrome (GBS)
clinical_study.official_title: Immunoadsorption Versus Plasma Exchange for Treatment of Guillain-Barré Syndrome (GBS)

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observations study evaluating safety and efficacy of immunoadsorption compared to plasma exchange in Guillain-Barré Syndrome.

primary_outcome.description: Combined score consisting of Inflammatory Neuropathy Cause and Treatment (INCAT) disability score, Oxford muscle strength score, and vibration score, equally weighted

primary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory Neuropathy Cause and Treatment (INCAT) disability score
primary_outcome.description: Standard clinical score for inflammatory neuropathies.

primary_outcome.measure: Oxford Muscle Strength Score (Medical Research Council, MRC)
primary_outcome.description: Standard clinical score for evaluating muscle strength / paresis. Muscle strength will be measured on a scale between 0 (no movement) and 5 (full strength) on 8 pre-defined muscles (one proximal and one distal muscle at each extremity).

Standard clinical score for evaluation of vibration sensitivity on a scale between 0 and 8, using a 256 tuning fork at 4 predefined spots (processus styloideus radii and malleolus lateralis on both sides).

secondary_outcome.description: Combined score consisting of Inflammatory Neuropathy Cause and Treatment (INCAT) disability score, Oxford muscle strength score, and vibration score, equally weighted

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory Neuropathy Cause and Treatment (INCAT) disability score
secondary_outcome.description: Standard clinical score for inflammatory neuropathies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxford Muscle Strength Score (Medical Research Council, MRC)
secondary_outcome.description: Standard clinical score for evaluating muscle strength / paresis. Muscle strength will be measured on a scale between 0 (no movement) and 5 (full strength) on 8 pre-defined muscles (one proximal and one distal muscle at each extremity).

Standard clinical score for evaluation of vibration sensitivity on a scale between 0 and 8, using a 256 tuning fork at 4 predefined spots (processus styloideus radii and malleolus lateralis on both sides).
Standard clinical score to quantify disability in Guillain-Barré syndrome
Pain quantified on a visual analog scale between 0 (no pain) and 10 (maximum pain).
N20 latency of nervus medianus (both sides) as measured by somatosensory evoked potentials (SEPs)
P40 latency of nervus tibialis (both sides) as measured by somatosensory evoked potentials
Nerve conduction velocity of clinically affected nerves as measured by electroneurography (ENG)

secondary_outcome.measure: Euro Quality of Life 5 Dimensions 5 Levels (EQ-5D-5L)
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of Life Scale
Immunoglobulin A serum concentration
Immunoglobulin A concentration in cerebrospinal fluid
Immunoglobulin G serum concentration
Immunoglobulin G concentration in cerebrospinal fluid
Immunoglobulin M serum concentration
Immunoglobulin M concentration in cerebrospinal fluid
Interleukin-1 serum concentration
Interleukin-6 serum concentration
Anti-GM1 antibody serum levels
Anti-GQQ1b antibody serum levels
Neurofilament light chain (NfL) serum levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Neurofilament light chain (NfL) in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)
secondary_outcome.description: Neurofilament light chain (NfL) levels in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)
Kind and frequency of Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
Share of patients with at least 20% improvement in CIDP score

intervention.description: 1 cycle, consisting of 5 sessions on 5 consecutive days with processing of the 0.7-fold individual plasma volume (maximum 2.5 l) each days with tryptophan adsorbers.
1 cycle, consisting of 5 sessions on 5 consecutive days with exchange of 0.7-fold plasma volume (maximum 2.5 l) each day with albumin solution as volume replacement solution.

study_pop.textblock: The study population consists of patients diagnosed with Guillain-Barré syndrome (GBS) who are treated with either plasma exchange or immunoadsorption in the Department of Neurology, University of Ulm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Guillain-Barré Syndrome according to the diagnostic criteria proposed by Doorn et al. (Clinical features, pathogenesis, and treatment of Guillain-Barré syndrome, Lancet neurology 2008)
- age 18 years or above
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical or laboratory (C-reactive protein 20 mg/l or above, or evidence of nitrite-positive urinary tract infection) evidence of manifest systemic infection
- Intake of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor within1 weeks before first treatment
- Other contraindications against immunoadsorption or plasma exchange

facility.name: Department of Neurology, University of Ulm

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported in this article, after de-identification (text, tables, and figures), as well as the study protocol will be available. Data will be available beginning 3 months and ending 5 years following article publication. Data will be shared with researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal. Data will be shared for analyses to achieve the aims in the approved proposal. Proposals should be directed to johannes.dorst@uni-ulm.de; to gain access, data requestors will need to sign a data access agreement. Data are available for 5 years at https://www.uniklinik-ulm.de/neurologie.html.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: 3 months after publication until 5 years after publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data will be shared with researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal. Data will be shared for analyses to achieve the aims in the approved proposal.
